verses.verse: Now <S%G3767><s%> when Festus <S%G5347><s%> was come into <S%G1910><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> province, <S%G1885><s%> after <S%G3326><s%> three <S%G5140><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> he ascended <S%G305><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem. <S%G2414><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> high priest <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> chief <S%G4413><s%> of the <S%G3588><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> him <S%G846><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> besought <S%G3870><s%> him, <S%G846><s%>

And desired <S%G154><s%> favor <S%G5485><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him, <S%G846><s%> that <S%G3704><s%> he would send for <S%G3343><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> laying wait <S%G4160><s%> <S%G1747><s%> in <S%G2596><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> way <S%G3598><s%> to kill <S%G337><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

But <S%G3767><s%> <S%G3303><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> that Paul <S%G3972><s%> should be kept <S%G5083><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Caesarea, <S%G2542><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> that he himself <S%G1438><s%> would <S%G3195><s%> depart <S%G1607><s%> shortly <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5034><s%> thither.

Let them <S%G3588><s%> therefore, <S%G3767><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> he, which among <S%G1722><s%> you <S%G5213><s%> are able, <S%G1415><s%> go down with <S%G4782><s%> me, and accuse <S%G2723><s%> this <S%G5129><s%> man, <S%G435><s%> if there be any <S%G1536><s%> <S%G2076><s%> wickedness <S%G824><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> when he had tarried <S%G1304><s%> among <S%G1722><s%> them <S%G846><s%> more <S%G4119><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> ten <S%G1176><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%> he went down <S%G2597><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea; <S%G2542><s%> and the <S%G3588><s%> next day <S%G1887><s%> sitting <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> judgment seat <S%G968><s%> commanded <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> to be brought. <S%G71><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> when he <S%G846><s%> was come, <S%G3854><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> which came down <S%G2597><s%> from <S%G575><s%> Jerusalem <S%G2414><s%> stood round about, <S%G4026><s%> and laid <S%G5342><s%> many <S%G4183><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> grievous <S%G926><s%> complaints <S%G157><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> which <S%G3739><s%> they could <S%G2480><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> prove. <S%G584><s%>

While he <S%G846><s%> answered for himself, <S%G626><s%> Neither <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> law <S%G3551><s%> of the <S%G3588><s%> Jews, <S%G2453><s%> neither <S%G3777><s%> against <S%G1519><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> temple, <S%G2411><s%> nor <S%G3777><s%> yet against <S%G1519><s%> Caesar, <S%G2541><s%> have I offended <S%G264><s%> any thing <S%G5100><s%> at all.

But <S%G1161><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> willing <S%G2309><s%> to do <S%G2698><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> a pleasure, <S%G5485><s%> answered <S%G611><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> and said, <S%G2036><s%> Wilt <S%G2309><s%> thou go up <S%G305><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> and there <S%G1563><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> these things <S%G5130><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> me? <S%G1700><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> said <S%G2036><s%> Paul, <S%G3972><s%> I stand <S%G1510><s%> <S%G2476><s%> at <S%G1909><s%> Caesar's <S%G2541><s%> judgment seat, <S%G968><s%> where <S%G3757><s%> I <S%G3165><s%> ought <S%G1163><s%> to be judged: <S%G2919><s%> to the Jews <S%G2453><s%> have I done no wrong, <S%G91><s%> <S%G3762><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> <S%G2532><s%> thou <S%G4771><s%> very well <S%G2573><s%> knowest. <S%G1921><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> I <S%G3303><s%> be an offender, <S%G91><s%> or <S%G2532><s%> have committed <S%G4238><s%> any thing <S%G5100><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> I refuse <S%G3868><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> to die: <S%G599><s%> but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> there be <S%G2076><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> of these things whereof <S%G3739><s%> these <S%G3778><s%> accuse <S%G2723><s%> me, <S%G3450><s%> no man <S%G3762><s%> may <S%G1410><s%> deliver <S%G5483><s%> me <S%G3165><s%> unto them. <S%G846><s%> I appeal <S%G1941><s%> unto Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>

<S%G1161><s%> Then <S%G5119><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> when he had conferred <S%G4814><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> council, <S%G4824><s%> answered, <S%G611><s%> Hast thou appealed <S%G1941><s%> unto Caesar? <S%G2541><s%> unto <S%G1909><s%> Caesar <S%G2541><s%> shalt thou go. <S%G4198><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> after <S%G1230><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> days <S%G2250><s%> king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Bernice <S%G959><s%> came <S%G2658><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> Caesarea <S%G2542><s%> to salute <S%G782><s%> Festus. <S%G5347><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> when <S%G5613><s%> they had been <S%G1304><s%> there <S%G1563><s%> many <S%G4119><s%> days, <S%G2250><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> declared <S%G394><s%> Paul's <S%G3972><s%> cause <S%G2596><s%> unto the <S%G3588><s%> king, <S%G935><s%> saying, <S%G3004><s%> There is <S%G2076><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G435><s%> left in bonds <S%G2641><s%> <S%G1198><s%> by <S%G5259><s%> Felix: <S%G5344><s%>

About <S%G4012><s%> whom, <S%G3739><s%> when I <S%G3450><s%> was <S%G1096><s%> at <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> chief priests <S%G749><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> elders <S%G4245><s%> of the <S%G3588><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> informed <S%G1718><s%> me, desiring <S%G154><s%> to have judgment <S%G1349><s%> against <S%G2596><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

To <S%G4314><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I answered, <S%G611><s%> It <S%G3754><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> the manner <S%G1485><s%> of the Romans <S%G4514><s%> to deliver <S%G5483><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man <S%G444><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> die, <S%G684><s%> before <S%G4250><s%> that <S%G2228><s%> he which is accused <S%G2723><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> accusers <S%G2725><s%> face to face, <S%G2596><s%> <S%G4383><s%> and <S%G5037><s%> have license <S%G2983><s%> <S%G5117><s%> to answer for himself <S%G627><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> crime laid against him. <S%G1462><s%>

Therefore, <S%G3767><s%> when they <S%G846><s%> were come <S%G4905><s%> hither, <S%G1759><s%> without any <S%G3367><s%> delay <S%G311><s%> on the <S%G3588><s%> morrow <S%G1836><s%> I sat <S%G2523><s%> on <S%G1909><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> judgment seat, <S%G968><s%> and commanded <S%G2753><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> man <S%G435><s%> to be brought forth. <S%G71><s%>

Against <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> when the <S%G3588><s%> accusers <S%G2725><s%> stood up, <S%G2476><s%> they brought <S%G2018><s%> none <S%G3762><s%> accusation <S%G156><s%> of such things <S%G3739><s%> as I <S%G1473><s%> supposed: <S%G5282><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> had <S%G2192><s%> certain <S%G5100><s%> questions <S%G2213><s%> against <S%G4314><s%> him <S%G846><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> their own <S%G2398><s%> superstition, <S%G1175><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> one <S%G5100><s%> Jesus, <S%G2424><s%> which was dead, <S%G2348><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> affirmed <S%G5335><s%> to be alive. <S%G2198><s%>

And <S%G1161><s%> because I <S%G1473><s%> doubted <S%G639><s%> of <S%G1519><s%> such manner of questions, <S%G2214><s%> <S%G4012><s%> <S%G5127><s%> I asked <S%G3004><s%> him whether <S%G1487><s%> he would <S%G1014><s%> go <S%G4198><s%> to <S%G1519><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2419><s%> and there <S%G2546><s%> be judged <S%G2919><s%> of <S%G4012><s%> these matters. <S%G5130><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> when Paul <S%G3972><s%> had appealed <S%G1941><s%> to be <S%G846><s%> reserved <S%G5083><s%> unto <S%G1519><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> hearing <S%G1233><s%> of Augustus, <S%G4575><s%> I commanded <S%G2753><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to be kept <S%G5083><s%> till <S%G2193><s%> <S%G3757><s%> I might send <S%G3992><s%> him <S%G846><s%> to <S%G4314><s%> Caesar. <S%G2541><s%>

Then <S%G1161><s%> Agrippa <S%G67><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> unto <S%G4314><s%> Festus, <S%G5347><s%> I would <S%G1014><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> hear <S%G191><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> man <S%G444><s%> myself. <S%G848><s%> <S%G1161><s%> Tomorrow, <S%G839><s%> said <S%G5346><s%> he, <S%G3588><s%> thou shalt hear <S%G191><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

And <S%G3767><s%> on the <S%G3588><s%> morrow, <S%G1887><s%> when Agrippa <S%G67><s%> was come, <S%G2064><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> Bernice, <S%G959><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> great <S%G4183><s%> pomp, <S%G5325><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> was entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> place of hearing, <S%G201><s%> with <S%G4862><s%> <S%G5037><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> chief captains, <S%G5506><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> principal <S%G2596><s%> <S%G1851><s%> men <S%G435><s%> of <S%G5607><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> city, <S%G4172><s%> at <S%G2532><s%> Festus' <S%G5347><s%> commandment <S%G2753><s%> Paul <S%G3972><s%> was brought forth. <S%G71><s%>

And <S%G2532><s%> Festus <S%G5347><s%> said, <S%G5346><s%> King <S%G935><s%> Agrippa, <S%G67><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G435><s%> which are here present <S%G4840><s%> with us, <S%G2254><s%> ye see <S%G2334><s%> this man, <S%G5126><s%> about <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> multitude <S%G4128><s%> of the <S%G3588><s%> Jews <S%G2453><s%> have dealt <S%G1793><s%> with me, <S%G3427><s%> both <S%G5037><s%> at <S%G1722><s%> Jerusalem, <S%G2414><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> also here, <S%G1759><s%> crying <S%G1916><s%> that he <S%G846><s%> ought <S%G1163><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to live <S%G2198><s%> any longer. <S%G3371><s%>

But <S%G1161><s%> when I <S%G1473><s%> found <S%G2638><s%> that he <S%G846><s%> had committed <S%G4238><s%> nothing <S%G3367><s%> worthy <S%G514><s%> of death, <S%G2288><s%> and <S%G1161><s%> that he <S%G5127><s%> himself <S%G848><s%> hath <S%G2532><s%> appealed <S%G1941><s%> to Augustus, <S%G4575><s%> I have determined <S%G2919><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>

Of <S%G4012><s%> whom <S%G3739><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> certain thing <S%G804><s%> <S%G5100><s%> to write <S%G1125><s%> unto my lord. <S%G2962><s%> Wherefore <S%G1352><s%> I have brought him forth <S%G4254><s%> <S%G846><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> you, <S%G5216><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> especially <S%G3122><s%> before <S%G1909><s%> thee, <S%G4675><s%> O king <S%G935><s%> Agrippa, <S%G67><s%> that, <S%G3704><s%> after examination <S%G351><s%> had, <S%G1096><s%> I might have <S%G2192><s%> somewhat <S%G5100><s%> to write. <S%G1125><s%>

For <S%G1063><s%> it seemeth <S%G1380><s%> to me <S%G3427><s%> unreasonable <S%G249><s%> to send <S%G3992><s%> a prisoner, <S%G1198><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> withal <S%G2532><s%> to signify <S%G4591><s%> the <S%G3588><s%> crimes <S%G156><s%> laid against <S%G2596><s%> him. <S%G846><s%>
